intro: Tupistra orlovii, commonly known as the Orlov’s spurge, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to conserve water. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
